The idea IS capable of changing the world. THIS is the real sense behind TPB, not only downloading illegal stuff and biting at the system, but creating something new, something better. How many films won't be shown because capitalism sees no $$$ in them? How many artists are frustrated by having no chance to publish their work? How many of us do know what is being made in Indonesia, Mexico or Tanzania??? How else can an ignored but otherwise talented director show what he/she is doing if not posting/ having it posted here? I've had the same idea before, but hey, how good TPB thought of it too AND DID SOMETHING ABOUT IT!!! Cheers! Way to go!!!
Thank you for this wonderful gift.  I hope your bravery catches on and we see more wonderful films we would otherwise never get to see or hear about.  Thanks again.

still, interesting movie, and i applaud the creators' decision to release it via TPB.

this is EXACTLY what I've been telling my friends about: if all the greedy corporate pigs in the movie and music industry would stop fighting file sharing and actually EMBRACE it, they would make a shiteload of money.

Its so effing simple and obvious:  if they would just create their own damn accounts and upload "official" movie and music torrents with a paypal link in the description and just ask people to donate based on how much they like it, they'd be MAKING money off file sharing instead of throwing away money trying to fight it.

Honestly, most people who pirate would NEVER pay $20 for a music CD or $35 for a BluRay. And I am not paying $1.39 a song on iTunes either. So they are not "losing money" because we pirate. You can't lose a sale on someone who never had any intention of buying. BUT, we are, in reality, an untapped market. So Hollywood, MIAA, how do you get money from from people who think you are greedy? Show us you're not and ASK us to donate if we like what we download. That's fair. That would be a mutually beneficial arrangement. 

So Stina Bergman, Bravo. I hope you are blazing a trail for many more to follow.

As I downloaded this, I read a few comments. Some people were harsh. I just finished it. I actually liked the movie. As an American, I can't help but think it is very Euro-tragic. A very European coming-of-age story. That's not meant as an insult. 

Yes, it is a little slow moving. I think that's probaby the American in me as this movie seems on pace with many other European flicks I've seen. But it is important to note it is suspenseful and to some extent, character-driven instead of explosions & car crash thrills. 

I hasten to add, it is a very poignant movie and deserves to be downloaded and shared.

That said, if there were another movie by the same people, I would download it. 

If you like good, thought-provoking movies and depressing films--or if you like things like "Man Bites Dog," you'll enjoy this film.
Thanks

I just seen it and really really enjoyed.  Seen it here on torrent download.


Very melancholy and memorable and bittersweet. Quite a unique film and the first foreign "artsy" effort I've not been inclined to fast-forward through.

I really wish this success and hope to see an update on all the actors someday. The women were all so pretty, and surely those girls are all becoming foxes now too, lol.

Thought it was chilling how the young narrator girl says, "In Sweden people don't die from hunger; they find other ways to die..." But this is not a cold movie. In fact I spewed a mouth-full of beer when that one clod husband thinks he'll stay another night and screw the wife if she'll make good on the tandoori chicken.

I wasn't offended at all about the somewhat chubby girl and the comments by her ass father, and she was quite a... sport about it and her oblivious "screw you" attitude was funny and priceless. But understand that in America there'd likely be ass reviewers that'd raise overwrought flags about that just as they do with the "nigger" word over here.

This film needs to be on the message boards and forums of big popular blogs and chat rooms. For I am just a lonely voice here at LiveJournal aand Facebookthat nobody visits :-(

They should leave it on TPB front page longer! It was the first and nothing took its place afterward. What was the rush to hustle it off after a mere 48 hours or so? 
And sadly TPB was suffering temporary outages I believe throughout your run-- probably enacted by the same sorts that refused you even the most meager of a theater distribution package for Die Beauty.

I'm not sure what I'd expected from Sweden images other than cold and Bjorn Borg. And it was surprising to me that this looks much like Summer in rural mid America and not at all a miserable permafrost prison.

I like the sort of dead pan, realistic acting throughout this.

And hey the dudes are all fine in their roles and believable. That strange Coroner guy did make me nervous though, and I've a feeling his Stepford daughter will have him in the river soon.

This deserves to be listed at IMDB.com, for I like it better than "Fargo" that won the Oscar in 1996.

( Update: If you do a search on Stina Bergman you'll find it on IMDB.com-- but the mofos at IMDB wont let you comment unless you "Confirm" your identity with a credit card and getting a pin# confirmation by way of your cell-phone, which I WONT DO! < Sort of stupid of IMDB.com, in that ANYBODY can make a "Review" over there on a quicky account without "Confirming." )
